hanzi-su-wiki:
項

Значения

Параграф, пункт; затылок

Мнемоника

Часть головы 頁, участвующая в работе 工 по переносу грузов на спине, затылок. Опускать голову, неся груз на спине. В переносном смысле — пункт, параграф. В тексте располагаются в порядке сверху вниз и, чтобы найти следующий пункт, каждый раз приходится опускать голову.

Варианты

项

heisig_chinese_memo: Before starting work at a new company, check each item on every page of the contract to make sure you're not committing to any extra duties..
heisig_constituent: paragraph, craft, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: To the right we see a head and to the left an element that means craft. When we think of a paragraph, we immediately think of a heading device to break a text into parts. (Think of the elaborate heads often seen at the start of medieval manuscripts and the task becomes easier still.) Just where and how to do it belongs to the writer's craft. Hence, we define paragraphing as the "heading craft" to remember this character.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: paragraph, nape of neck, clause, item, term (expression)
koohiiStory1: To write a paragraph is the craft of grouping sentences on a page.
koohiiStory2: To craft a page well, we need paragraphs.
jp_example_words:
事項(じこう): matter, item, facts
項目(こうもく): item
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Construction for geoducks doesn't require as much paperwork as construction for humans, but you still need to write at least a paragraph to explain what you're doing.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Actually imagine yourself writing one paragraph of explanation to the city so you can get the permits to construct housing for your geoducks. On the form, it specifies you should only write a paragraph.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You turn in your paragraph, and it is given to Emperor こういち, who insists on being involved in all construction projects. Surprisingly, he approves your construction project, thanks to that paragraph you wrote in the application.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
In that paragraph, you praised こういち for being a great emperor, and you said that this construction project would help you to have more time to do your WaniKani reviews. Clearly you were pandering to Emperor こういち when you wrote it. But hey, it worked!
Hint: When you see 工 in a kanji it will often take the こう reading.

Ru_trainchinese:
xiàng: (сч.слово/сущ) счетное слово для пунктов, предложений; (матем.) член; китайская фамилия
xiàng: (графема) задняя часть шеи; сумма (денег)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the work (工) on the page (頁) is a paragraph
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Before starting work at a new company, check each item on every page of the contract to make sure you're not committing to any extra duties.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " page ", " work " sound, the original meaning is the back of the neck, also refers to the neck in general. "Shuowen": "The head and the back. From the page, the sound of the work." "Zuo Zhuan-the 16th year of Chenggong": "Wang Zhao Yang Youji, with two arrows, so that Lu Qi, Zhongxiang, Fu Tao."

" Item " can indicate the back of the crown. "Yi Li-Shi Guan Li": "Bin holds the item with his right hand, and holds the front face with his left hand." Jia Gongyan: "After the crown is the item."

" Items " can also indicate types and terms. Song Wang Mingqing's "Three Records of Wielding Mistakes" Volume Three: "This group of captives is not many, and they are returned to their teachers. Today, they are of little interest."

" Item " can also be used as a quantifier, mostly used for sub-items. Song Zhang Duanyi's "Guei Er Ji" is written down: "If it is, then the reputation is its own, and the career is its own."
humanum_short_description_en: From " page ", " work " sound, the original meaning is the back of the neck, also generally refers to the neck.
humanum_full_description:
從「頁」，「工」聲，本義為頸的後部，亦泛指頸。《說文》：「頭後也。从頁，工聲。」《左傳‧成公十六年》：「王召養由基，與之兩矢，使射呂錡，中項，伏弢。」

　　「項」可表示冠的後部。《儀禮‧士冠禮》：「賓右手執項，左手執前進容。」賈公彥疏：「冠後為項。」

　　「項」也可表示種類、條款。宋王明清《揮麈三錄》卷三：「此項虜寇，人數不多，又是歸師，在今日無甚利害。」

　　「項」還可用作量詞，多用於分項目的事物。宋張端義《貴耳集》卷下：「如是則聲名自是一項，事業自是一項。」
humanum_short_description: 從「頁」，「工」聲，本義為頸的後部，亦泛指頸。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 工 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 工 [ gōng ] labor, work; laborer, worker
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
①頸的後部，泛指脖子：頸項。項鍊。項縮(縮脖子，形容羞怯、畏縮的樣子)。強項。
②量詞，分類的條目，：項目。事項。
③錢款，經費：款項。進項。存項。
④數學用語，代數式中不用加、減號連接的單式，如“4ａx2”。
⑤姓氏。

Heisig: To the right we see a head and to the left an element that means craft. When we think of a paragraph, we immediately think of a heading device to break a text into parts. (Think of the elaborate heads often seen at the start of medieval manuscripts and the task becomes easier still.) Just where and how to do it belongs to the writer's craft. Hence, we define paragraphing as the "heading craft" to remember this character.

從「 頁 」，「 工 」聲，本義為頸的後部，亦泛指頸。《說文》：「頭後也。从頁，工聲。」《左傳‧成公十六年》：「王召養由基，與之兩矢，使射呂錡，中項，伏弢。」 「 項 」可表示冠的後部。《儀禮‧士冠禮》：「賓右手執項，左手執前進容。」賈公彥疏：「冠後為項。」 「 項 」也可表示種類、條款。宋王明清《揮麈三錄》卷三：「此項虜寇，人數不多，又是歸師，在今日無甚利害。」 「 項 」還可用作量詞，多用於分項目的事物。宋張端義《貴耳集》卷下：「如是則聲名自是一項，事業自是一項。」
From " page", " work" sound, the original meaning is the back of the neck, also refers to the neck in general. "Shuowen": "The head and the back. From the page, the sound of the work." "Zuo Zhuan-the 16th year of Chenggong": "Wang Zhao Yang Youji, with two arrows, so that Lu Qi, Zhongxiang, Fu Tao." " Item" can indicate the back of the crown. "Yi Li-Shi Guan Li": "Bin holds the item with his right hand, and holds the front face with his left hand." Jia Gongyan: "After the crown is the item." " Items" can also indicate types and terms. Song Wang Mingqing's "Three Records of Wielding Mistakes" Volume Three: "This group of captives is not many, and they are returned to their teachers. Today, they are of little interest." " Item" can also be used as a quantifier, mostly used for sub-items. Song Zhang Duanyi's "Guei Er Ji" is written down: "If it is, then the reputation is its own, and the career is its own."

xiàng
вм. 项
Radicals: 工, 頁  (construction, geoduck)
Meaning Mnemonic
Construction for geoducks doesn't require as much paperwork as construction for humans, but you still need to write at least a paragraph to explain what you're doing.
Actually imagine yourself writing one paragraph of explanation to the city so you can get the permits to construct housing for your geoducks. On the form, it specifies you should only write a paragraph.
Reading Mnemonic
You turn in your paragraph, and it is given to Emperor こういち, who insists on being involved in all construction projects. Surprisingly, he approves your construction project, thanks to that paragraph you wrote in the application.
In that paragraph, you praised こういち for being a great emperor, and you said that this construction project would help you to have more time to do your WaniKani reviews. Clearly you were pandering to Emperor こういち when you wrote it. But hey, it worked!
Hint: When you see 工 in a kanji it will often take the こう reading.
